She said that could bring many jobs here to Rochester. What that tax credit is about is it allows businesses that are innovators, entrepreneurial businesses like a lot of the businesses in Rochester to invest in research in development and get a credit for that investment. So really it makes a difference in creating jobs, particularly in growing industries like high tech, bio-tech, energy technology, optical technology all of that work that we do in Rochester would really benefit greatly from an R&D tax credit that's permanent. `` Without Simon Cowell , I'm not sure how successful Idol would have been, regardless of how good( Season 1 winner) Kelly Clarkson was,'' says Atlanta Journal-Constitution blogger Rodney Ho. How much will viewers miss Simon Cowell 's commentary? That's the question. At the same time, Ho says, Simon Cowell seemed less interested last season, which contributed to a less-than-ideal judging panel. The show's producers acknowledge that there was a lack of chemistry on the panel.

Providing Vermont and other states with the flexibility to build upon health care reform will result in better care and greater access at a lower cost. Allowing us to become a laboratory for innovation and excellence will help Vermonters, while once again allowing us to lead the way.
